channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Wildflower Watch: Silver lupine among the wildflowers in bloom at Rodeo Beach
item.description: Silver lupine enriches the soil by holding atmospheric nitrogen and nurtures a relationship with other flora.
item.dc:creator: Joan Linn Bekins

item.title: Belvedere settles profiling suit with Yema shop owners for $10k
item.description: The city denies wrongdoing in a deal that ends all legal actions related to 2020 incident.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Navigation app alert system aims to protect firefighters
item.description: It sends alerts to drivers’ phones when they’re approaching an emergency vehicle on the roadside or when an emergency vehicle is coming up behind them.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Playground experts emphasize accessibility, nature-based play at Tiburon parks forum
item.description: The town wants to upgrade the playground at Cypress Hollow Park, potentially put one at Zelinsky Park and make other improvements to the lineal system.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A retiree finds joy in the simple pleasures of living in Belvedere
item.description: The former contract-furniture executive moved from San Anselmo seeking a one-story home with a two-car garage on the water.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Teachers to get 8% in raises – not enough, union says
item.description: Reed Union School District teachers are set to receive an 8.15% salary boost over the next two school years — though the president of the...
item.dc:creator: Emily Lavin

item.title: City joins campaign against boulevard bike lanes
item.description: Belvedere is again raising safety concerns, this time taking its appeal directly to the state.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Belvedere’s $14.2M draft budget prioritizes Beach Road seawall
item.description: The city is expected to spend $2.66 million to stabilize the seawall while also allocating more toward legal expenses amid ongoing lawsuits.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Rhythm, tradition shine at AAPI fest
item.description: The Tiburon Asian American and Pacific Islander Heritage Festival was held May 17 at Zelinsky Park.
item.dc:creator: The Ark
